summary: This document is an email chain forwarding a U.S. Department of Justice press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, along with perjury charges related to 2016 depositions. The email includes congratulatory remarks from recipients.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sexual activity, conspiracy, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell between 1994 and 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release announcing the charges against Maxwell and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged role in the abuse.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement in the press release commending the victims for their bravery and detailing the FBI's role in the investigation.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement in the press release condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls between 1994 and 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a federal indictment with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein exploited girls as young as 14, grooming and abusing them in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell is charged with perjury for making false statements under oath during depositions in a 2016 civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse occurred from at least 1994 to 1997, involving victims as young as 14 years old.
Maxwell is charged with perjury for false statements made during sworn depositions in 2016.
The alleged grooming and abuse took place at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's London residence.
The case is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Public Corruption Unit and assigned to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
